dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Ha ha ha! Oh my gosh, B, did you even read this weather forecast for Kazakhstan? What is happening there?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Ha ha ha! Oh my gosh, B, did you even read this weather forecast for Kazakhstan? What is happening there?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, A, I saw it. For March 13th to 15th, right? It's, um, quite varied, I guess you could say.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, A, I saw it. For March thirteenth to fifteenth, right? It's, um, quite varied, I guess you could say.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kazhydromet meteorologists have released a weather forecast for Kazakhstan on March 13, 14, and 15.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Varied? It sounds like, um, every possible weather event is just, like, simultaneously occurring!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Varied? It sounds like, um, every possible weather event is just, like, simultaneously occurring!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, not quite everywhere, actually. See, the east and central parts, they've got this big anticyclone. So, dry conditions there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, not quite everywhere, actually. See, the east and central parts, they've got this big anticyclone. So, dry conditions there.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to the forecast, an anticyclone will dominate the weather in the eastern and central parts of Kazakhstan, bringing dry conditions.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Dry. Okay. But then, like, rain and snow somewhere else?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Dry. Okay. But then, like, rain and snow somewhere else?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. That's the western, northwestern, and northern regions. They're getting a trough from a western cyclone, so, uh, precipitation there. Plus stronger winds and, oh, icy roads, too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. That's the western, northwestern, and northern regions. They're getting a trough from a western cyclone, so, uh, precipitation there. Plus stronger winds and, oh, icy roads, too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Meanwhile, the western, northwestern, and northern regions will be influenced by a trough of a western cyclone, leading to precipitation in the form of rain and snow, stronger winds, and icy roads.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Icy roads! And then, the south just gets, like, sunny and warm? How does that even work?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Icy roads! And then, the south just gets, like, sunny and warm? How does that even work?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right, the south. That's a southern cyclone trough. It's different. It means sunny and dry weather, um, and actually, temperatures are gonna rise really significantly there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, the south. That's a southern cyclone trough. It's different. It means sunny and dry weather, um, and actually, temperatures are gonna rise really significantly there.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the southern part of the country, a trough of a southern cyclone will contribute to sunny and dry weather, allowing temperatures to rise significantly.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, like, dry in the east, rain and snow in the west, sunny in the south, but then, like, foggy across the whole country? That just, uh, that makes no sense!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, like, dry in the east, rain and snow in the west, sunny in the south, but then, like, foggy across the whole country? That just, uh, that makes no sense!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Foggy conditions are expected across Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, the fog is more like a general, um, condition that can settle over different weather patterns, A. It's not, like, mutually exclusive.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, the fog is more like a general, um, condition that can settle over different weather patterns, A. It's not, like, mutually exclusive.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, okay. And the temperatures are just, like, wildly different everywhere.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, okay. And the temperatures are just, like, wildly different everywhere.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah. So, in the north, um, nighttime temperatures are actually going up from really cold, like, minus twenty-five, to around minus fifteen at the lowest. And daytime could even hit plus five.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah. So, in the north, um, nighttime temperatures are actually going up from really cold, like, minus twenty-five, to around minus fifteen at the lowest. And daytime could even hit plus five.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the north of the country, nighttime temperatures are expected to rise from -10 to -25ÂC to -0 to -15ÂC, and daytime temperatures from -0 to -10ÂC to -2 to +5ÂC.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Above freezing? In the north? Wow.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Above freezing? In the north? Wow.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yep. And in the east, uh, also warming up, though still pretty chilly overall, like, up to eight degrees Celsius during the day.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yep. And in the east, uh, also warming up, though still pretty chilly overall, like, up to eight degrees Celsius during the day.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the east... while daytime temperatures will increase from -2 to -13ÂC to -3 to +8ÂC.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: But the west and south, they're actually, like, getting warm?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But the west and south, they're actually, like, getting warm?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, yeah. West and south. They're looking at, like, ten to twenty-two degrees Celsius at night. That's, um, pretty significant.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, yeah. West and south. They're looking at, like, ten to twenty-two degrees Celsius at night. That's, um, pretty significant.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the west and south, nighttime temperatures will range from 0 to +8ÂC, reaching up to +10 to +22ÂC,

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Twenty-two degrees at night? While it's still below freezing, like, a few hundred miles north? Man. Kazakhstan, huh?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Twenty-two degrees at night? While it's still below freezing, like, a few hundred miles north? Man. Kazakhstan, huh?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Kazakhstan, indeed, A. It's a very big place.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Kazakhstan, indeed, A. It's a very big place.
